newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RBA says bought A$11.6 bln of forex in 1996.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RBA says bought A$11.6 bln of forex in 1996.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) said it had bought foreign exchange worth a total A$11.6 billion in 1996, with about A$4.0 billion of this acquired in the fourth quarter.

"The bank used the strength of the exchange rate over 1996 to buy back some of the foreign currency reserves it had sold in the early 1990s in support of the exchange rate," the RBA said in its quarterly review of the economy.
Of the total, A$3.7 billion was used to meet the regular foreign exchange needs of the government and the rest to reduce outstanding foreign exchange swaps, the Bank said.
The RBA intervened heavily in 1993 to support the Australian dollar which had slumped to a seven year low around 64 cents in September of that year.
In contrast, the currency was in an uptrend for much of 1996 which carried it from 73 cents at the start of the year to a six-year peak of US$0.8212 in December.
